bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 11 (Friday, January 13, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. STEWART:H.R. 365.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Tenth Amendment, United States Constitution Article IV,section 3, clause 2, United States Constitution Article 1,section 8, clause 18[Page H238]

item.title: University of Utah Research Park Act

latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 159.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Lands.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text: This bill releases to the University of Utah, without consideration, the reversionary interest of the United States in approximately 593 acres of specified nonfederal land.

bill.title: To release the reversionary interest of the United States in certain non-Federal land in Salt Lake City, Utah, and for other purposes.

item.title: To release the reversionary interest of the United States in certain non-Federal land in Salt Lake City, Utah, and for other purposes.
To release the reversionary interest of the United States in certain non-Federal land in Salt Lake City, Utah, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Lands.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
